definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: In clinic, regulating the opening and closing of orifices is an important method of treating diseases.
sentences.chinese: 在临证中调节诸窍的开阖是治疗疾病的重要手段。

sentences.english: Once they are underwater, they close and fold the winglike fins so that they can swim.
sentences.chinese: 在水底时，他们就阖起翼状的鳍开始游泳。

definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]
to open and close (the mouth etc)/friendly/compliant/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
